Reviews.Title: “Great little gem”
Reviews.Author: Mansur A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a gem. The staff is very friendly and love to talk to you if you have time. My room, for one person, was beutiful, the bed is confortable. Excellent location. Bathroom space is tight. Location of hotel is not easy to find by taxis. Make sure to print the full address and a location map to give to Taxi. Many restaurants just one street over.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cruiser360
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Saba Sultan after leaving a cruise ship. Very friendly staff; great location; clean. Generally excellent renovation, although the shower doors did not quite close at the bottom (forgot to mention this to the staff). Breakfast adequate but the orange juice seemed chemical, a contrast to the fresh-squeezed juice available in the stalls. Hard to find but worth finding!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a short stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TravelAurelie
Reviews.Content: The two receptionists at the hotel were adorable, the room was great, breakfast was delicious and we felt heartily welcome. What's more, the hotel is located within walking distance (5 minutes) from all of Istanbul's "must-sees" (Blue mosque, St. Sophia, Topkapi Palace). I would definitely recommend the place to anyone, including couples with a baby...

Reviews.Title: “City trip @ Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jolien F
Reviews.Content: We want to thank you for the hospitality, welcome and good service. It was our first time in Turkey and certainly not the last. We have all visited on foot, by the central location of this hotel. the staff was very friendly and helpful. They were ready to inform us about the most beautiful places in Istanbul. Upon arrival we were immediately shown the room, asking if that was good for us. The room was very spacious. Thanks to the nice weather we can enjoy the rooftop terrace. In other words, a real winner. Greetings from Belgium!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, especially front desk, and close to Ayasofia & blue mosque!”
Reviews.Author: JoseCaSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nothing fancy, but it was in a great location! The room was good size. What I remember the most about this hotel is the friendly staff, especially the front desk staff. Will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF, SERVICE, HOTEL AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Diijay O
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect and the staffs, EXCELLENT. I was there for four nights with my girl friend and did not feel like returning to Finland. The breakfast WAS abundant, quality and nourishing. The rooms were fatastic with golden coated calved designs. High quality mattress, great bathroom and toilet. Free and fast wi-fi, tidy environment. The STAFFS WERE CARING, asking about our welfare and how much we enjoyed our outings and Istanbul. The receptionist gave a map and told us about places to visit. He was always ready to render assitance at any time. The lady cook was nice, the night before our departure, we told her we needed the breakfast 30minutes earlier, she made it available and packaged it well for us to take along to the Airport. It was a GREAT EXPERIENCE. My BABE (girl friend) MADE A WISE CHOICE. I shall lodge in this hotel anytime I visit Istanbul...IT WORTH ITS VALUE.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: D J g
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, warm and cosy atmosphere. The Hotel has a real authenticity in Istanbul, very close to Blue Mosque and St Sophia. Staff devoted to customers, very professional. All the team was nice and kind to us .Receptionist Hilmi was very kind and accomodating in helping with anything we asked for. Everything went well from the beginning until the check out. What's more, we have been upgraded for free, which is always a nice gesture to customers. I was there with my grand parents and was treated very well for my first trip overseas. Room (Family suite) was very confortable, clean and kept up.Breakfast was fresh, well cooked, and they fixed omlet with cheese for me which was very good. Knowing that I liked this the cook fixed for me as soon as I walked in for breakfast.. No doubt a great place to enjoy tourism in Istanbul ! Charming and comfortable hotel. If I ever return to Istanbul again I will definitly stay in this Hotel Saba Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Basheer A
Reviews.Content: I liked the quietness of the hotel, and yet being close to the historic attractions in the old part of Istanbul. it is a few minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and Topkapi Palace. Deleicious breakfast, and friendly staff. Spacious and cosy reception area. Room is provided with tea making tools and water.

Reviews.Title: “very exquisite boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: FabioBardi
Reviews.Content: stayed here for few days beginning of january and ad a very nice time. hotel was spotless and so was the room. stuff very friendly and a good location as well. would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, beautifully decorated rooms, perfect location in theold centre near Sultanahmet Mosque.”
Reviews.Author: Anna S
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, beautifully decorated rooms, perfect location in theold centre near Sultanahmet Mosque and St.Sophia Cathedral.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexander L
Reviews.Content: Good clean Hotel close to important sights. Friendly staff and helpful. Breakfast could be a little bit more various. We will recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a strategic location”
Reviews.Author: ilaria p
Reviews.Content: Strategic location, 3 minutes walk from Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque, 5 minutes from sultanahmet tram stop. Located in a very quiet neighborhood, with shops, Arasta bazaar and restaurants (touristic). Rooms very clean, with wi-fi, free water in mini-bar; very abundant breakfast buffet, complete with typical jams and cakes. Hotel staff very kind and helpful Definitely recommended! Ilaria

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Saba Sultan hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dijana M
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 3 minutes walk from Aya Sofia and other great sights. The room was very clean and nice, perfect for our needs. The hotel was very clean and the stuff more than helpful and friendly. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. If we would return to Istanbul we would come back to Saba Sultan hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Claire A
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 2 nights in this most gracious hotel.The room was very clean and the staff most helpful, specially ther reception clerks. Breakfast was typically turc, with american favorites like toasts, eggs and orange juice. I recently recommended the hotel to 2 of my friends who are planning a trip to Istanbul and would certainly return myself . Claire

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Had Stayed Longer”
Reviews.Author: wdb91
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise. We should have spent more time. Istanbul is a fascinating City and Saba Sultan is excellently situated to allow an exploration of the old City. A short walk to the Blue Mosque through a surprisingly quiet and safe neighbourhood. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good (not great) but more than adequate. We had a room high at the back of the hotel with a fantastic view over the Marmara Sea. Check out the roof top terrace for the best view. Try the Tria Elegance restaurant right around the corner for a great meal. We would gladly come back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs and at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: Location - location - location ! The hotel is within walking distance of the major attractions and near transportation links. The staff was helpful and friendly and their English was better than our Turkish. The room was of an adequate size and very clean. Breakfast was more than adequate and included in the daily rate. There are many restaurants and convenience stores in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great location made even better by the wonderful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kev P
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant stay in an excellent location in the old city, an awesome view from the roof terrace (Sea and Blue Mosque), and super friendly/helpful staff. Breakfast was always fresh and tasty until 10:30 for those who like to sleep late. Very quiet street with no outside noise (even the very early morning call for prayers one could sleep) There could be some internal improvement from doors that are nice tight and require a good slam to close...not to pleasant if you want to sleep-in and also hearing all the various plumbing sound (shower, flushing, etc...) but hey, maybe it's me ;-) Would recommend to anyone to stay if you get a rate under 200TL....T hanks for the nice memories!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maureen615
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this boutique hotel in the heart of the old city. Newly renovated, whimsical furniture, comfortable beds, great showers. Sumptuous breakfasts. The staff was gracious, friendly and helpful. Quiet rooms with windows that open and quiet a/c. Leisutely 10 minute walk to Blue mosque, Topkapi Palace, restuarants, tram etc.

Reviews.Title: “service”
Reviews.Author: aytak g
Reviews.Content: thanks for every things your hotel service was great . hotel is nice and hotel rooms are so clean ,hotel is near Aya sufiya mosque that it was good..thanks from mr. savas capar who helped me and our family in every thing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet room in the heart of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: Cindy A
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Saba Sultan was excellent. On a dead end street, it was initially a little hard to find, but that street combined with soundproof windows made for a wonderfully quiet room. We didn't even hear the early morning call to prayer even though the hotel is a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque! Location is very good - close to the major sights, a variety of restaurants, the Arasta bazaar, transportation as well as the sea. Wireless internet was free and had a strong signal, and numerous electrical outlets made phone/computer charging convenient. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was perfectly adequate, and complementary water each day in a small refrigerator in the room was nice. Only complaint was one burned out lightbulb. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: Spending a little extra on this hotel is a good deal. Location is everything : it is close to the heart of Istanbul, as well as to an area filled with shops and restaurants. This is the place to start walking in Istanbul. The Hotel is new and modern; great staff. Breakfast is incredible. I will consider definitively it for my next visit: perfect location and a nice big bed in a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay couldnt have been better!”
Reviews.Author: bart_djmp
Reviews.Content: Our stay couldnt have been better! We were welcomed with friendly and smiling staff in a gorgeous room. The hotel is new, nice, very quiet and so comfortable we felt like home. The boiler in room and complimentary water help a lot after long journeys, or after some long sightseeing days one cannot avoid when the localization is so perfect and the city is so great! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, practical, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Joyaw
Reviews.Content: First, youâ€™ve to know that this is not a designer hotel. And as expected, like most hotels, it doesnâ€™t look as stylish as the official pictures they posted on the web. The rooms, the bathroom, the corridors, the staircase and the elevator, as well as the basement breakfast area all look more like a local house than a hotel. Itâ€™s absolutely no gimmicks; all areas are clean, neat, and tidy; and everything casual but practical. The rooms are brightly lit unlike the dim lightings in other hotels weâ€™ve stayed at; the shower is a little small but water pressure strong and hot water abundant. Theyâ€™ve a wi-fi server on every floor so internet connection is reasonably good. Breakfast is simple but youâ€™ll still be able to find all the standard stuffs such as bread, eggs, cheese, ham, and cereal. The hotel is just 5-10 minutes walk from the tramway station and major attractions thus very convenient. Itâ€™s located on a small street one block down a touristy restaurant street in the area so you can enjoy the convenience while staying away from the noise. One minor complain: there is only one very tiny trash can in the bathroom and none in the room......we definitely need more garbage capacityâ€¦â€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: kenneth7573
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal. Right in the center of the old city of Istanbul. It is very clean and well taken care of. Great and even wonderfull location. Just steps away from the Topkapi seray. Very convenient. Helpful staff, and nice rooms. The room i Had was huge by European standards, clean and orderly. The hotel staff helped me with directions and navigating the old streets of the city center. Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, an amazing hotel to start exploring an enchanting metropole”
Reviews.Author: jdely
Reviews.Content: Saba Sultan is a hotel that has everything within it's reach: Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, the Old town, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern and so much more... The hotel is also very close to a street filled with cozy restaurants & bars offering the opportunity for a great evening & meal. As I said before, the location is very central yet very quiet! This might be one of the best places to sleep good at night. The hotel is small, safe and cosy. Comfortable rooms with good beds. And if you're lucky, a splendid seaview! Breakfast is fresh and ok. Last but not least the hotel has very friendly staff, always ready to help and give advice with a smile! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not wheelchair accessible”
Reviews.Author: elliecowan
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as it clearly states on their website that the hotel has wheelchair facilities. I visited Istanbul with my Granny who is 90 and in a wheelchair and my mother. There are 3 large steps outside the hotel with no ramp. You have to lift the wheelchair up the steps and then the door is only wide enough for the wheelchair to fit through and so it is very difficult to negotiate. I requested a twin room for my Granny and mother with wheelchair access. We were given a double with no wheelchair access. We were then changed to a twin room but it was a lot smaller and again not really wheelchair accessible. We had to make do. There was a sea view, but I paid less money for a room without a sea view and it was double the size. The staff at the desk were really unsympathetic with regards to the wheelchair and kept telling us to go to restaurants which were really not wheelchair accessible. We did not listen to their advice after the 1st attempt! We were really disappointed with the service overall. The hotel itself is fine and in a good location. The rooms can be a little small and I thought that it was a little pricey for the room that my mother and granny had. Istanbul was great and the wheelchair was nowhere near as difficult to navigate round the city (once we'd left the hotel) as we first thought.

Reviews.Title: “small but neat, quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: husean
Reviews.Content: Near Blue Mosque in the old town. Newly remodeled 14 rooms on three floors. Very quiet and clean. Offer the free and rich Turkey styled breakfast buffet every day. Three receptists taking full day shift, Aghan, Hilaic and Savas do face-to-face contact with customer every day. They are polite and friendly. Like talking to neightborhood boys, House maid clean room every day while staying. Room rate is very fair even cheap. I would like check in there again if I'm going to come back..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: raoul050
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, room, breakfast, location and at a very good price! Perfect for a single traveller or a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Saba Sultan”
Reviews.Author: Jag8211
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel right in the centre of all the action. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel. To top it up, the friendly staff ensured we would not look for any other hotel when in Istanbul the next time. Just a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, and Topkapi Palace..... Have to specially mention that the staff was very helpful and friendly. Meltem actually went out of her way to help us with the tours, restaurants and cafes. She was definitely Godsent for us guiding us to the best places around town.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor: DON'T GO THERE!”
Reviews.Author: Anabel_Mihai
Reviews.Content: One of the most horrible hotel experience I have ever had, was here. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished, I'll give you that, but they are rather small and there is no wardrobe space, not to mention the view from the rooms. It's like living in the ghetto. The air conditioning was also impossible to live with as it made a terrible noise and couldn't chill the room, it just gave us headaches. But these are the most insignifiant problems I could find. The issue is that there is NO RUNNING WATER in this hotel. The reception handeled the problem with a smile and told us that water was to come after 10 oÃ§lock in the morning, this seemingly being a common thing at the hotel, but not for us as well.. We had to change the hotel, because the water wouldn't go as high as the 2nd floor, where we stayed. We spent an entire morning waiting for the water to ''rise'' but nothing happened until 11 o'clock when we had to check out of the hotel and move to another one. Nevertheless the breakfast was incredibly poor. All in all, I would not even reccomend this hotel to my enemies. There are many nice hotels in Istambul. Try another one!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Saba Sultan
HotelInfo.Address: Akbiyik cad, Cetinkaya Sokak No 4 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
